item.title: Creation Vs. Evolution
item.dc:creator: @magicrcher_2 magicrcher 2
item.description:
@magicrcher_2 wrote:

lol [quote=“Davidi2, post:154, topic:316305”]People seem to be chaning the topic of this thread from “Creation vs Evolution” to “God vs Science”.

The fact is that while most scientists do not believe that we were created by God, there are many people who believe in both science, and creationism, including myself. I believe God created us, along with the possibility for evolution.

What I am trying to say is that the debate is pointless. No one here is going to convince the other party to believe what they believe. The topic title explains to voice your opinion, not debate with other people why they are wrong.[/quote]

i know this is werid to say but can someone lock my topic i gusse there is a chance for evloution but that doesnt make me belive

Read full topic

item.title: Creation Vs. Evolution
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

People seem to be chaning the topic of this thread from “Creation vs Evolution” to “God vs Science”.

The fact is that while most scientists do not believe that we were created by God, there are many people who believe in both science, and creationism, including myself. I believe God created us, along with the possibility for evolution.

What I am trying to say is that the debate is pointless. No one here is going to convince the other party to believe what they believe. The topic title explains to voice your opinion, not debate with other people why they are wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Creation Vs. Evolution
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

A better debate would be what makes religions so stuck on an idea that they completely abolish all other possibilities. As moparisthebest said earlier, they can coexist. Nearly anything is possible if each “Book” says that they’re right if you follow common logic. If you think your right, your right; if you think you’re wrong, you’re right.

Read full topic

item.title: Creation Vs. Evolution
item.dc:creator: @magicrcher_2 magicrcher 2
item.description:
@magicrcher_2 wrote:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:149, topic:316305”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=412877.msg3044646#msg3044646 date=1259378575]

Wow, if you are going to start a debate thread, at least attempt to get your spelling close.

Creation vs Evolution is what you meant.

And why can’t you believe in both? Nothing in the bible says that God could not have created the earth and life as we know it through the process of Evolution that He set up. If our biological ancestors were apes, then at a certain point in our evolution God infused one of our ancestors with a soul and that was the first human being.

They don’t contradict each other.

god says that he made us out of the sand of earth thats waht bible says i think if we were from apes he wouldent have said adam was from the sand of eath

Jesus spoke in parables some times did he not? Why can’t the story of adam and eve also be a parable? The point of the story is that God created all things, and that human choice is the thing that brought evil into the world, understand?

On-topic, it’s tough to choose. Evidence leads to both. Honestly, the living will never know so it’s not worth debating.

Please provide evidence of creationism without refering to the bible. Not trying to start shit, I am interested in this evidence.

On-topic, it’s tough to choose. Evidence leads to both. Honestly, the living will never know so it’s not worth debating.

Where’s the evidence for creationism?

The ‘big-bang theory’ is the generally accepted scientific theory for the creation of the universe right? It says, basically, that a long time ago there was a massive explosion which formed the universe, what it doesn’t say is what caused that explosion. That is the evidence for creationism. (God caused the big-bang)
[/quote]
You are awesome! I’ve been questioning creation vs. evolution for some time now and, thanks to you, I definitely know I’m sticking to my faith in Christianity. MITB = My hero. :P[/quote]

to be hoenst i was loosing faith too tehy almost had me but never will i cahnge

Read full topic

The ‘big-bang theory’ is the generally accepted scientific theory for the creation of the universe right? It says, basically, that a long time ago there was a massive explosion which formed the universe, what it doesn’t say is what caused that explosion. That is the evidence for creationism. (God caused the big-bang)[/quote]
You are awesome! I’ve been questioning creation vs. evolution for some time now and, thanks to you, I definitely know I’m sticking to my faith in Christianity. MITB = My hero.

item.title: Creation Vs. Evolution
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:316305”]Wow, if you are going to start a debate thread, at least attempt to get your spelling close.

Creation vs Evolution is what you meant.

And why can’t you believe in both? Nothing in the bible says that God could not have created the earth and life as we know it through the process of Evolution that He set up. If our biological ancestors were apes, then at a certain point in our evolution God infused one of our ancestors with a soul and that was the first human being.

They don’t contradict each other.[/quote]

In that debate, what was before the big bang, If there was nothing, how was the big bang created from nothing…just to get you thinking.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 24-12-2009, 13:33:07[/size][hr][quote=“The Reaper X, post:144, topic:316305”][quote author=magicrcher 2 link=topic=412877.msg3042127#msg3042127 date=1259191765]
what do u belive in evelation or creation?

i say creation!!
eveltion says we were monkeys ow thats stupid
[/quote]So you don’t believe in something just because you don’t want to think of the possibility that we were once as dumb as apes? When you’re an adult will it also be a fact that you don’t want to believe that you were once a child, immature and dumb?

I believe in both. We were created from something, but everything over time has evolved from whatever we started from.[/quote]

Deoxyribonucleic acid, show that we could have evolved from apes as were have very similar DNA paterns and we also share some of that with the DNA stucture of a banana.
